title: Hydroponics ABR
description: A fully automated and monitored hydroponics system managed through a web server.
content:
About the Project

Hydroponics ABR (Automated and Monitored Hydroponics System) is an innovative solution developed by Driggs Code, based in Buenos Aires, using the NFT (Nutrient Film Technique) model. This system circulates a nutrient-rich water film through plant roots, monitored by sensors for pH and flow, automating corrections to maintain a pH of 7. A pump ensures oxygenation, and a timer-controlled dropper supplies minerals, promoting eco-friendly cultivation.

Environmental Benefits

  • Saves water
  • Enables production in challenging conditions
  • Eliminates agrochemicals (herbicides, pesticides)
  • Delivers high-quality crops
  • Prevents land overexploitation
  • Minimizes weed issues

Client

The client senses data, corrected via automation, with measurements, username, and password sent to the server via sockets.

Server

The server stores data in a database and sends email alerts for plant health risks.

Web

Built with PHP and AJAX, the web interface offers login, real-time data monitoring, and a 'My Progress' section for weekly plant growth photos.

Programmer

Octavio Bottari - LinkedIn

License

Open-source under MIT License.

Contact

Reach out at contact@driggscode.com.

project_details.project_summary: Hydroponics ABR is a sustainable web-managed hydroponics system designed to automate plant growth monitoring and nutrient delivery, reducing environmental impact.
project_details.challenge: Developing a reliable sensor integration and automation system within a tight budget, ensuring scalability for various crop types.
project_details.goals_for_the_project: Create an eco-friendly, user-friendly platform to monitor and automate hydroponics, promoting sustainable agriculture in Argentina and beyond.

unique_selling_points: Leverages Argentine technical expertise at a fraction of U.S. costs, with real-time collaboration due to time zone alignment (EST+1).

title: Piatto
description: A food ordering platform with in-store pickup, live order status, and automation.
content:
About the Project

Piatto, crafted by Driggs Code in Buenos Aires, is an all-in-one food ordering platform automating restaurant sales. It offers in-store pickup, live order status, digital menus, personalized discounts, and intelligent scheduling—without commission fees.

Key Features

  • Automated order processing with clear confirmations
  • Customizable menus and pricing via a user-friendly panel
  • WhatsApp integration for customer communication
  • Secure payments without aliases
  • Professional branding with logos and banners

Setup Process

  1. Subscribe to the monthly plan; Driggs Code sets up your digital store.
  2. We design a personalized page with your logo and payment options.
  3. Share your unique link (e.g., piattoweb.com/yourrestaurant) to start selling.

Benefits

Piatto saves time, boosts sales, and ensures a secure, optimized experience, made in Argentina for global reach.

Contact

Learn more via WhatsApp or email contact@driggscode.com.

title: Private Works
description: A web application aimed at fostering public-private partnerships in Argentina to accelerate public works.
content:
About the Project

Obras Privadas, developed by Driggs Code, is a Django-based web application connecting citizens, businesses, and the Argentine government to enhance public infrastructure. Citizens propose projects, the community votes, and businesses compete to finance top initiatives, promoting transparency.

Project Details

  • Service: Full Stack Web Development
  • Duration: 8-10 Weeks
  • Budget: $10,000 - $20,000

Goals

Build an intuitive platform for project proposals, voting, and financing, integrated with government APIs like Mi Argentina.

Challenge

Ensuring transparency, security, and seamless collaboration among stakeholders while meeting regulatory standards.

Contact

Inquire at contact@driggscode.com.
